content: What is the capital of France?
Paris
What is the population of Paris?
The population of Paris is approximately 2.16 million people.
Can you tell me a famous landmark in Paris?
A famous landmark in Paris is the Eiffel Tower.
Who designed the Eiffel Tower?
The Eiffel Tower was designed by Gustave Eiffel.
When was the Eiffel Tower built?
The Eiffel Tower was built between 1887 and 1889.
What is another famous museum in Paris?
Another famous museum in Paris is the Louvre Museum.
What is the Louvre Museum known for?
The Louvre Museum is known for housing the Mona Lisa.
How many visitors does the Louvre get annually?
The Louvre Museum receives over 9 million visitors annually.
What is the river that runs through Paris?
The river that runs through Paris is the Seine.
Can you name a famous cathedral in Paris?
A famous cathedral in Paris is Notre-Dame Cathedral.
What is the height of the Eiffel Tower?
The Eiffel Tower is 324 meters tall.
How many steps are there to the top of the Eiffel Tower?
There are 1,665 steps to the top of the Eiffel Tower.
What is the nickname of Paris?
Paris is often called 'The City of Light'.
Why is Paris called 'The City of Light'?
Paris is called 'The City of Light' because of its leading role during the Age of Enlightenment and more literally because it was one of the first large European cities to use gas street lighting.
What is the most famous street in Paris?
The most famous street in Paris is the Champs-Élysées.
What famous structure is at the end of the Champs-Élysées?
The Arc de Triomphe is at the end of the Champs-Élysées.
Who commissioned the Arc de Triomphe?
The Arc de Triomphe was commissioned by Napoleon Bonaparte in 1806.
What event does the Arc de Triomphe commemorate?
The Arc de Triomphe commemorates the victories of the French armies during the Napoleonic Wars.
What is the main art museum in Paris?
The main art museum in Paris is the Louvre.
What is the most famous painting in the Louvre?
The most famous painting in the Louvre is the Mona Lisa.
Who painted the Mona Lisa?
The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci.
What is the size of the Mona Lisa?
The Mona Lisa measures 77 cm by 53 cm.
What is another famous painting in the Louvre?
Another famous painting in the Louvre is 'Liberty Leading the People' by Eugène Delacroix.
When was 'Liberty Leading the People' painted?
'Liberty Leading the People' was painted in 1830.
What event does 'Liberty Leading the People' depict?
'Liberty Leading the People' depicts the July Revolution of 1830 in France.
Who is the woman in 'Liberty Leading the People'?
The woman in 'Liberty Leading the People' represents Liberty.
What is the name of the famous church on Montmartre?
The famous church on Montmartre is the Basilica of the Sacré-Cœur.
When was the Basilica of the Sacré-Cœur built?
The Basilica of the Sacré-Cœur was built between 1875 and 1914.
What style is the Basilica of the Sacré-Cœur built in?
The Basilica of the Sacré-Cœur is built in the Romanesque-Byzantine style.
What is the highest point in Paris?
The highest point in Paris is Montmartre.
What is the main public park in Paris?
The main public park in Paris is the Jardin des Tuileries.
Who designed the Jardin des Tuileries?
The Jardin des Tuileries was designed by André Le Nôtre.
What is the name of the famous avenue that runs from the Louvre to the Arc de Triomphe?
The famous avenue is the Avenue des Champs-Élysées.
What is the famous glass pyramid at the Louvre?
The famous glass pyramid is the Louvre Pyramid.
Who designed the Louvre Pyramid?
The Louvre Pyramid was designed by the architect I. M. Pei.
When was the Louvre Pyramid completed?
The Louvre Pyramid was completed in 1989.
When was the Palais Garnier built?
The Palais Garnier was built between 1861 and 1875.
Who was the architect of the Palais Garnier?
The architect of the Palais Garnier was Charles Garnier.
What is the main street for luxury shopping in Paris?
The main street for luxury shopping in Paris is the Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honoré.
What is the name of the famous bookshop in Paris?
The famous bookshop is Shakespeare and Company.
When was Shakespeare and Company founded?
Shakespeare and Company was founded in 1919.
Who founded Shakespeare and Company?
Shakespeare and Company was founded by Sylvia Beach.
What famous American author lived in Paris and frequented Shakespeare and Company?
The famous American author was Ernest Hemingway.
What is the name of the famous palace in Versailles?
The famous palace in Versailles is the Palace of Versailles.
When was the Palace of Versailles built?
The Palace of Versailles was built in the 17th century.
Who built the Palace of Versailles?
The Palace of Versailles was built by Louis XIV.
What is the Hall of Mirrors?
The Hall of Mirrors is a grand hall in the Palace of Versailles, known for its seventeen mirror-clad arches.
What major event took place in the Hall of Mirrors?
The Treaty of Versailles, which ended World War I, was signed in the Hall of Mirrors.
How many rooms are in the Palace of Versailles?
The Palace of Versailles has over 700 rooms.
What is the name of the gardens at the Palace of Versailles?
The gardens at the Palace of Versailles are called the Gardens of Versailles.
Who designed the Gardens of Versailles?
The Gardens of Versailles were designed by André Le Nôtre.
What is the name of the famous museum in Paris that was once a railway station?
The famous museum is the Musée d'Orsay.
When was the Musée d'Orsay opened?
The Musée d'Orsay was opened in 1986.
What type of art is the Musée d'Orsay known for?
The Musée d'Orsay is known for its collection of Impressionist and Post-Impressionist masterpieces.
What is the name of the modern art museum in Paris?
The modern art museum in Paris is the Centre Pompidou.
When was the Centre Pompidou opened?
The Centre Pompidou was opened in 1977.
What is the architectural style of the Centre Pompidou?
The Centre Pompidou is known for its high-tech architecture.
What is the name of the famous church in Paris with twin towers?
The famous church with twin towers is Notre-Dame Cathedral.
When was Notre-Dame Cathedral built?
Notre-Dame Cathedral was built between 1163 and 1345.
Who is the famous French author associated with Notre-Dame Cathedral?
The famous French author associated with Notre-Dame Cathedral is Victor Hugo.
What famous novel did Victor Hugo write about Notre-Dame Cathedral?
Victor Hugo wrote the novel 'The Hunchback of Notre-Dame'.
What is the name of the large public square in Paris?
The large public square in Paris is Place de la Concorde.
What is the name of the famous avenue that leads from the Arc de Triomphe?
The famous avenue that leads from the Arc de Triomphe is the Avenue des Champs-Élysées.
What is the name of the famous bridge in Paris that crosses the Seine?
The famous bridge is Pont Neuf.
What is the name of the famous island in the middle of Paris?
The famous island in the middle of Paris is Île de la Cité.
What is the name of the famous palace on Île de la Cité?
The famous palace on Île de la Cité is the Palais de Justice.
What is the name of the famous chapel in the Palais de Justice?
The famous chapel is Sainte-Chapelle.
When was Sainte-Chapelle built?
Sainte-Chapelle was built between 1242 and 1248.
What is Sainte-Chapelle known for?
Sainte-Chapelle is known for its stunning stained glass windows.
What is the name of the famous garden in Paris?
The famous garden in Paris is the Luxembourg Gardens.
When were the Luxembourg Gardens created?
The Luxembourg Gardens were created in 1612.
Who created the Luxembourg Gardens?
The Luxembourg Gardens were created by Marie de' Medici.
What is the name of the famous street market in Paris?
The famous street market in Paris is the Marché aux Puces de Saint-Ouen.
What is the Marché aux Puces de Saint-Ouen known for?
The Marché aux Puces de Saint-Ouen is known for being one of the largest flea markets in the world.
When was the Marché aux Puces de Saint-Ouen established?
The Marché aux Puces de Saint-Ouen was established in 1870.
What is the name of the famous palace in Paris where the French Senate meets?
The famous palace is the Luxembourg Palace.
What is the name of the riverbank area in Paris known for its bookstalls?
The riverbank area is called the Rive Gauche or Left Bank.
What is the name of the famous cabaret in Paris?
The famous cabaret in Paris is the Moulin Rouge.
When was the Moulin Rouge opened?
The Moulin Rouge was opened in 1889.
What is the Moulin Rouge famous for?
The Moulin Rouge is famous for its can-can dance performances.
What is the name of the famous café in Paris where intellectuals used to meet?
The famous café is Café de Flore.
What is the name of the famous restaurant in Paris with a Michelin star?
The famous restaurant is Le Jules Verne.
Where is Le Jules Verne located?
Le Jules Verne is located on the second floor of the Eiffel Tower.
What is the name of the famous boulevard in Paris known for its theaters?
The famous boulevard is Boulevard de Montparnasse.
What is the name of the famous university in Paris?
The famous university in Paris is the Sorbonne University.
When was the Sorbonne University founded?
The Sorbonne University was founded in 1257.

The famous basilica is the Basilica of the Sacred Heart or Sacré-Cœur.
Where is the Sacré-Cœur located?
The Sacré-Cœur is located at the summit of the butte Montmartre, the highest point in the city.

The famous square is Place du Tertre.
What is Place du Tertre known for?
Place du Tertre is known for its artists and painters.

The famous department store is Galeries Lafayette.

Galeries Lafayette was founded in 1893.

The famous exhibition center is the Grand Palais.

The Grand Palais was built for the 1900 Exposition Universelle.

The Grand Palais is known for its large glass dome and hosting exhibitions.

The famous park in Paris that was the site of the 1900 Olympic Games is the Bois de Vincennes.
How large is the Bois de Vincennes?
The Bois de Vincennes covers an area of 995 hectares (2,459 acres).
What is the name of the famous museum in Paris that is housed in a former railway station?
The famous museum in Paris that is housed in a former railway station is the Musée d'Orsay.
When did the Musée d'Orsay open to the public?
The Musée d'Orsay opened to the public on December 9, 1986.
What is the name of the famous park in Paris that features a zoo and a natural history museum?
The famous park in Paris that features a zoo and a natural history museum is the Jardin des Plantes.
When was the Jardin des Plantes established?
The Jardin des Plantes was established in 1626.
What is the name of the famous church in Paris that is the burial site of many French kings and queens?
The famous church in Paris that is the burial site of many French kings and queens is the Basilica of Saint-Denis.
When was the Basilica of Saint-Denis constructed?
The Basilica of Saint-Denis was constructed in the 12th century.
What is the name of the famous fountain in Paris that depicts a chariot pulled by four horses?
The famous fountain in Paris that depicts a chariot pulled by four horses is the Fontaine des Quatre-Saisons.
When was the Fontaine des Quatre-Saisons constructed?
The Fontaine des Quatre-Saisons was constructed between 1739 and 1745.
What is the name of the famous museum in Paris that is dedicated to the works of Pablo Picasso?
The famous museum in Paris that is dedicated to the works of Pablo Picasso is the Musée Picasso.
When did the Musée Picasso open to the public?
The Musée Picasso opened to the public in 1985.
